content: Hey guys, since ubuntu 18.04 is now the LTS, when will there be support for 18.04 in the installer script? Also is there a way to bypass this check since I am already running 18.04 in my infrastructure?
Ok looks like changing 3 lines in the install scripts allow a server to be installed
@James Zhao for bionic, as soon as we release Zulip 1.9. Until then, cloning master and running the installer will work.
@Tim Abbott Do you have a timeline on when that will happen?
@James Zhao not a precise one; I'm currently at a 25-person Zulip summit event, and getting 1.9 out will be the first priority on return.
So I'd guess a release candidate late next week, and then the official release the week after.
Alright, thanks. I have zulip running on bionic and I can definitely help with testing

hey guys, the production tutorial at https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/install.html#step-1-download-the-latest-release says, Bionic is supported, but when i try to install it, i get an error, that it's not supported?!
@THP you need to install from master (it's not supported in the 1.8.1 release)
Thanks for quick support! Iwill try it asap

i got the next error... 

+ apt-get install -y puppet git curl wget python python3 python-six python3-six crudini
Reading package lists...
Building dependency tree...
Reading state information...
E: Unable to locate package puppet
E: Unable to locate package crudini
@THP hmm, I think you need to add the Ubuntu universe repository for those packages.
Just merged 2f36211fdecc3c43e17f808238dbd3efc6a1341f to clarify this in the docs; might be nice to have a better installer error message here as well.
